agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from a Johnson Memorial Hospital provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for partial financial assistance based on their income.

Call the Patient Accounts office or contact a financial counselor at Johnson Memorial hospital to request a Financial Assistance Application. The Financial Assistance Application may also be submitted online.
site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from Johnson Memorial Hospital (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income

agency_name: WHITE RIVER TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - JOHNSON COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: WHITE RIVER TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - JOHNSON COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A public school offering a variety of programs including adult basic education, high school equivalency (HSE) testing, English as a second language, and entry level training for select career fields.
service_description: Offers instruction in basic reading, math, language arts, technology, life skills, and job readiness. Morning and evening classes available throughout the year.
site_details: Visit website to register for orientation.
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Not in high school (high school exit documentation required for ages 16-17)

agency_desc: A public school offering a variety of programs including adult basic education, high school equivalency (HSE) testing, English as a second language, and entry level training for select career fields.
service_description: Offers English language learning courses with training on English speaking, listening, writing, and reading. Open to beginners as well as more advanced English speakers. Participants with good attendance may continue in the class as long as needed. Evening and day classes are available.
site_details: Call, walk in, or visit website to register for orientation.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Not enrolled in high school -- Native language is not English

agency_desc: A public school offering a variety of programs including adult basic education, high school equivalency (HSE) testing, English as a second language, and entry level training for select career fields.
service_description: Serves as an official testing center for Indiana's high school equivalency (HSE) test, which enables people who did not complete high school to earn a high school equivalency diploma. Testing at this location takes place over the course of two days and is offered once monthly, in either paper or computer format. Readiness tests are also available.
site_details: Visit website to register. -- Walk in during office hours at least prior to the HSEA test or readiness test to register. Payment due at time of registration.
site_schedule: Information/Registration: Mon-Thurs 9am-7pm -- Testing: Twice monthly (Test is two days, usually Mon and the following Tues 4:45pm-9:30pm) -- Readiness Test: Once monthly from 5pm-9pm
site_eligibility: Lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_desc: A public school offering a variety of programs including adult basic education, high school equivalency (HSE) testing, English as a second language, and entry level training for select career fields.
service_description: Offers adult continuing education and job training classes in areas such as computer technology, medical terminology and coding, Quickbooks, welding, and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR). Entry-level certified nursing assistant (CNA), firefighter, emergency medical technician (EMT), and heating/ventilation/air conditioning (HVAC) training are also available.
site_details: Call, walk in, or visit the website for current class catalog or to register. -- Register at least 10 days prior to the start of class.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Not enrolled in a regular high school program

agency_desc: A public school offering a variety of programs including adult basic education, high school equivalency (HSE) testing, English as a second language, and entry level training for select career fields.
service_description: Offers adult continuing education and job training classes in areas such as computer technology, medical terminology and coding, Quickbooks, welding, and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR). Entry-level certified nursing assistant (CNA), firefighter, emergency medical technician (EMT), and heating/ventilation/air conditioning (HVAC) training are also available.
site_details: Call, walk in, or visit the website for current class catalog or to register. -- Register at least 10 days prior to the start of class.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Not enrolled in a regular high school program

agency_desc: Maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections and voter registration; issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Johnson County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections and voter registration; issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Johnson County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides affordable home ownership opportunities to qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF JOHNSON COUNTY
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to request an application or visit website.
site_eligibility: To apply for a home: Lived in Johnson County for at least 1 full year -- Unable to get conventional loan -- Able to make payments (steady employment history or equivalent income)

agency_desc: A nonprofit, full-service, primary care health center that provides family practice medical care regardless of income or insurance status.
service_description: Provides a full-service, primary care health center that specializes in family practice regardless of income or insurance status. agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men and women who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing outreach services to at-risk and homeless youth, including case management and a drop-in center.
service_description: Provides street outreach and a drop-in center for homeless, runaway, and at-risk youth. Services include clothing, education assistance, case management, and counseling. Offers referrals for housing, medical assistance, drug/alcohol rehabilitation, and employment. The drop-in center provides a safe haven for street youth to eat a meal, relax, and develop goals for education, employment, housing, and other areas necessary to become independent.

site_eligibility: Age 16-25 years-old -- Homeless, runaway, or at risk of homelessness

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing services to children at risk of developmental delays and all persons with disabilities who live in Johnson and surrounding counties. Also provides public transportation in Johnson County through Access Johnson County.
service_name: ACCESS JOHNSON COUNTY - ZONE TO ZONE DEMAND RESPONSE
service_description: Provides on-demand (curb-to-curb) public transportation within Johnson County (as far north as Stop 11 and just into Marion County). Can go farther for those with CICOA vouchers. All vans are wheelchair accessible. Services are by reservation; limited slots available.
site_details: Call to make reservations 24 hours in advance; weekend reservations must be made by noon on Friday.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 9am-noon and 12:30pm-4pm -- Transit Services: Mon-Fri 6:15am-6:45pm
site_eligibility: Persons traveling within Johnson County or north to Stop 11 (can go farther for those with CICOA vouchers)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing services to children at risk of developmental delays and all persons with disabilities who live in Johnson and surrounding counties. Also provides public transportation in Johnson County through Access Johnson County.
service_description: Provides a public transportation service within Johnson County, with fixed and flexible routes including regular stops at Greenwood Park Mall, Community South Hospital, Johnson Memorial Hospital, and several other key locations. Zip Connect flex rides provide transportation one-half to one mile on either side of the fixed routes or city limits. All buses are wheelchair accessible.
site_details: Wait at assigned stop or call 24 hours in advance to schedule a deviation (pickup within one (1) mile of either side of fixed route or city limits). -- Call or visit website for fees and route information.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.

agency_desc: Offers a faith-based full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers an educational and supportive group that meets for four weekly sessions to help children 5-12 years old learn about grief and share with others who have experienced the death of a loved one. Topics include physical effects of grief, emotional impact, sleep difficulty, utilizing available support, loneliness, depression, anger, holiday coping, and hope for the future. Groups are offered quarterly.
site_details: Call for availability; parent or guardian of child must call to register.
site_eligibility: * Ages 5-12 * Experienced the death of a loved one

agency_desc: Offers a faith-based full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.

site_details: Call or visit website to register prior to attending group.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides inpatient and outpatient substance abuse treatment.
service_description: Offers holistic, residential care including therapy, education, 12-Step programs, and family involvement for men and women. Length of stay is typically 30-42 days. Longer-term transitional housing is available for men who require further treatment.
taxonomy_name: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides inpatient and outpatient substance abuse treatment.
service_description: Provides detoxification treatment for persons at risk of experiencing withdrawal symptoms resulting from extended alcohol or other drug use. Individuals are monitored on a 24-hour basis by licensed medical staff. Once individuals are medically stable, they may begin the next phase of treatment.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for an initial assessment and to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environment hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the  health and safety of Johnson County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, public swimming pools and hot tubs, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air and water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers mosquito control programs and indoor air quality inspections for homes and businesses in Johnson County.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Johnson County

site_eligibility: Living in Johnson County -- Individuals, not businesses

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environment hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Testing: Tues and Thurs; by appointment
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environment hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Immunizations: Tues and Thurs by appointment only
site_eligibility: Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environment hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering comprehensive behavioral health care for all ages.
site_name: ADULT AND CHILD - NORTHWOOD PLAZA - FRANKLIN
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Johnson County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). agency_desc: A commercial organization that provides home and GPS tracking medical alert devices that monitor and dispatch first responders or call pre-arranged emergency contacts 24/7 based on the need. This service is designed to preserve an individual's safety and independence. The actual 24/7 monitoring service is subcontracted out to another provider.
service_description: Provides electronic equipment which connects frail seniors or people who have disabilities with police or other emergency response personnel after a fall, injury, or other medical emergencies.  Electronic devices that can be rented include Personal Emergency Response Systems (PERS) for home or mobile units with GPS tracking, and Auto Fall Sensors.  Additional features that are available include smoke, fire, or carbon monoxide detectors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Installation: By appointment only
site_eligibility: Individuals at risk of falls or other injuries -- Individuals at risk of isolation
